org.knowhowlab.osgi.jmx.service.monitor
Interface MonitorAdminMBean

public interface MonitorAdminMBean

This MBean provides the management interface to the OSGi Monitor Admin Service

Author:
dmytro.pishchukhin

STATUS_VARIABLE_TYPE

static final javax.management.openmbean.CompositeType STATUS_VARIABLE_TYPE
The Composite Type for a StatusVariable. It contains the following items:

  • TYPE
  • COLLECTION_METHOD
  • TIMESTAMP
  • VALUE

Constant Field Values

EVENT_TYPE

static final javax.management.openmbean.CompositeType EVENT_TYPE
The Composite Type for a StatusVariable change event. It contains the following items:
  • MONITORABLE_PID_ITEM
  • STATUS_VARIABLE_NAME_ITEM
  • STATUS_VARIABLE_VALUE_ITEM
  • EVENT_INITIATOR_ITEM

Method Detail

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription(java.lang.String path)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       java.io.IOException
Returns a human readable description of the given StatusVariable. The null value may be returned if there is no description for the given StatusVariable.

Parameters:
path - the full path of the StatusVariable in [Monitorable_ID]/[StatusVariable_ID] format
Returns:
the human readable description of this StatusVariable or null if it is not set
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is null or otherwise invalid, or points to a non-existing StatusVariable
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

getStatusVariable

javax.management.openmbean.CompositeData getStatusVariable(java.lang.String path)
                                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                  java.io.IOException
Returns a StatusVariable addressed by its full path. The Composite Data is typed by STATUS_VARIABLE_TYPE.

Parameters:
path - the full path of the StatusVariable in [Monitorable_ID]/[StatusVariable_ID] format
Returns:
StatusVariable typed by STATUS_VARIABLE_TYPE
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is null or otherwise invalid, or points to a non-existing StatusVariable
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

getMonitorableNames

java.lang.String[] getMonitorableNames()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Returns the names of the Monitorable services that are currently registered. The returned array contains the names in alphabetical order. It cannot be null, an empty array is returned if no Monitorable services are registered.

Returns:
the array of Monitorable names
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

getStatusVariables

javax.management.openmbean.TabularData getStatusVariables(java.lang.String monitorableId)
                                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                 java.io.IOException
Returns the StatusVariable objects published by a Monitorable instance. The returned Tabular Data is typed by STATUS_VARIABLES_TYPE. The elements in the returned array are in no particular order.

Parameters:
monitorableId - the identifier of a Monitorable instance
Returns:
StatusVariables typed by STATUS_VARIABLES_TYPE
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if monitorableId is null or otherwise invalid, or points to a non-existing Monitorable
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

getStatusVariableNames

java.lang.String[] getStatusVariableNames(java.lang.String monitorableId)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                 java.io.IOException
Returns the list of StatusVariable names published by a Monitorable instance. The returned array does not contain duplicates, and the elements are in alphabetical order. It cannot be null, an empty array is returned if no (authorized and readable) Status Variables are provided by the given Monitorable.

Parameters:
monitorableId - the identifier of a Monitorable instance
Returns:
a list of StatusVariable objects names published by the specified Monitorable
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if monitorableId is null or otherwise invalid, or points to a non-existing Monitorable
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

switchEvents

void switchEvents(java.lang.String path,
                  boolean on)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         java.io.IOException
Switches event sending on or off for the specified StatusVariables.

Parameters:
path - the identifier of the StatusVariable(s) in [Monitorable_id]/[StatusVariable_id] format, possibly with the "*" wildcard at the end of either path fragment
on - false if event sending should be switched off, true if it should be switched on for the given path
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is null or otherwise invalid, or points to a non-existing StatusVariable
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

resetStatusVariable

boolean resetStatusVariable(java.lang.String path)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                   java.io.IOException
Issues a request to reset a given StatusVariable.

Parameters:
path - the identifier of the StatusVariable in [Monitorable_id]/[StatusVariable_id] format
Returns:
true if the Monitorable could successfully reset the given StatusVariable, false otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is null or otherwise invalid, or points to a non-existing StatusVariable
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails

getRunningJobs

javax.management.openmbean.TabularData getRunningJobs()
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
Returns the list of currently running MonitoringJobs. The returned Tabular Data is typed by MONITORING_JOBS_TYPE

Returns:
MonitoringJobs typed by MONITORING_JOBS_TYPE
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the operation fails
